Intro.p: The SIF NZ data model was forked from the SIF AU data model, includes the following (high-level) changes:

li.p: The SchoolInfo data object from SIF AU is replaced with Organisation data object, as the scope of SIF NZ data model is intended to encompass early childhood education, compulsory schooling (K-12) and tertiary education (higher education).
Organisation also describes education organisations (such as KƒÅhui Ako, and Learning Support Clusters) that are known to the NZ education system, not limited to Schools and other Providers.

ul.li: OrganisationRelationship data object records relationships between two education organisatons

li.p: StudentPersonal, StaffPersonal and StudentContactPersonal data objects no longer share the same PersonInfo object, as each The Privacy Act means that the set of data we are permitted to store for each class of person is different.
Demographics area includes NZ statistical standard Ethnicity and Iwi affiliations.

ul.li: StudentProviderEnrolment expands on StudentSchoolEnrollment, and has extra complexity to cope with SIF NZ having Schools, ECEs and TertiaryOrganisations, rather than just Schools.

Staff & Student assignment and enrolment to TeachingGroups are explicitly modelled with transactional data objects StaffTeachingGroupAssignment and StudentTeachingGroupEnrolment. Merely including staff & students in the TeachingGroup object is insufficient for Privacy Act requirements, we need to know exactly when staff and students were connected via their membership of TeachingGroup.
